resources.string: Cafe de Angelo is a quaint coffee shop tucked in a dainty garden along. This garden cafe is a popular spot for locals and tourists to hang out and spend a chill afternoon. Take your pick from their house blends—De Angelo Blend, Barako, and Italian Roast—to go with your choice of comfort food like their Zoolander Burger and Chicharon Pasta for your midday fill.
54 Chapis Village, Marcos Highway, Baguio City

Cafe by the Ruins was rebuilt into a romantic, modern cafe, reclaiming its title as one of the. A visit to this iconic cafe is not complete without trying their signature Ruins Coffee infused with cinnamon and cardamom that\'s sure to uplift your mood. Plus, you can take home-baked pastries like Luisa\'s Ensaymada and Ernie\'s Camote Bread that are sure to be a hit with the family!

Taste the best Arabica coffee in the Philippines at Cafe Yagam, one of the most beloved cafes in Baguio. This well-loved coffee shop permanently closed its store last September due to the pandemic but opened a new stall called Nest Coffee Roasters two months later—much to the delight of its loyal patrons. This new stall located in Calle Uno serves coffee and pastries to those who missed and want to taste. The cafe\ns new small and humble red-bricked stall allows the coffee to take center stage. If you happen to be in Baguio, don\nt forget to drop by, grab a cup of coffee, and take a bag of Yagam Coffee home!
Calle Uno Building, #3 Escoda (First Road) cor. Naguilian Road, Quezon Hill, Baguio City

If you like grilled food, then you would love to know that there\'s a place in Baguio where not only can you get unlimited, but you also get to grill the food yourself! For P199 for lunch and P249 for dinner, you can get to grill food all you want at IhawJuan. There is a wide selection of meat, vegetables, seafood, and grilling and dipping sauces at the counter. Fried rice, plain rice, and soup are unlimited too.
Ground Floor, Blue Mountain Hotel, 18 Marcos Highway, Baguio City
Te Quiero Tapas Bar offers unlimited tapa for P350 every Friday. Enjoy free live acoustic music during Tapas Nights.
Microtel Inns and Suites, Upper Session Road, Baguio City
Have your own platter of Mongolian Barbeque for P210. If you plan to eat in groups, try O\'Mai Khan\'s Mongolian Hot Pot, which is P420, good for 4 people.

Burnham Park is a large city park located in front of The Melvin Jones Grandstand, in Baguio City, Philippines. There are many activities to be enjoyed by visitors, such as boating on the man-made lake, skateboarding and riding rides on the amusement park\'s kiddie rides, eating strawberry taho and other local delicacies at food stalls, or picnicking under the pine trees.
Jos Abad Santos Drive, Baguio City

Located in the heart of Baguio City, The Wright Park is a tranquil natural area that is perfect for nature lovers and those who want to get some exercise. There are several walking trails and horseback riding opportunities available, making it an ideal place to spend a day out.
The Mansion, Romulo Drive, Baguio City

The Baguio Botanical Garden is a beautiful spot in the city where visitors can explore a variety of plants and flowers. The park has a variety of different areas, including individual pavilions dedicated to the cities that Baguio shares relationships with. There are also plenty of benches to relax on and activities to do, like taking a lunch break or exploring the gardens. If you\'re interested in nature then this is definitely a place you should visit.
Our Lady of the Atonement Cathedral (Diocese of Baguio)

The catholic cathedral in Baguio City, Philippines is a stunning building with distinctive pink façade and rose window. It is popular for its beauty and is one of the top tourist destinations in Baguio City.
2600 Steps To Our Lady Of Atonement Cathedral, Baguio City

The Bell Church is a Buddhist temple located in the town of La Trinidad, halfway between Baguio City and the city of La Trinidad, in the Philippines. The temple features Taoist architecture alongside some Buddhist features, and is a popular tourist destination due to its tranquil environment and views from the courtyard. A small lily pond is included.
Bell Church Rd, La Trinidad, Benguet

Baguio isn't immune to the infectious shopping bug that SM Super-malls brings to the country’s major cities with the existence of SM City Baguio.


Located in Luneta Hill in Upper Session Road, SM City Baguio opened in 2003 and since then has been the largest shopping mall in the whole North Luzon region. It is also the only mall to not utilize a central air-conditioning system and the second mall to make use of natural lighting, the other being the SM Mall of Asia.


It has all the makings of your usual SM mall: a food court filled with different fusion cuisines; an activity area where they host lively local events; a department store; as well as multiple levels dedicated to beauty and well-being, appliance and home needs, and gadget and tech retails. What sets it apart, though, is the stunning view from each level's balconies where you can see Burnham Park, Baguio Cathedral, and even Session Road. It is also home to the only DFA passport office in the Cordillera region.
Luneta Hill, Upper Session Road, Baguio City

Session Road in Baguio is considered as the city\'s cauldron of business and trade, where merchants big and small open shop to the teeming tourists and shoppers. Due to shopping centers like the famous Porta Vaga Mall, which opened in 2002, business in Session Road is always alive.
Porta Vaga, Session Road, Baguio City

Some businesses in Baguio have existed long enough that they have been a pillar of what has been deemed the "Baguio City Experience." Such a pillar is Tiong San, who dubs itself "Suki ng Bayan" (the people's favorite).


And why shouldn't it? Tiong San has been operating for over seven decades among three generations of proprietors, building a sense of trust and value for shoppers in the region along the way.


Currently, Tiong San shopping center caters to a vast array of local and global brands, from apparel to houseware to tech peripherals. They also have their own full-range supermarkets and meat shops. Tiong San has also partnered with government agencies and local government units to promote local industry, environmental sustainability, and entrepreneurship.
